chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter M Helfenstein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Costs to be paid in 6 months (11/25/22) or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Concurrent with count 2, 74 days credit - TIME SERVED
Concurrent with: COUNT 2

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

02:24 PM Defendant Peter M Helfenstein in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Alyssa Marilee Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 3, 4, 5 and 6 are dismissed and read in.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
74 Days Jail.  (Credit - 74 days).  CONCURRENT with Count 2.  COURT DEEMS TIME SERVED.

COSTS: $ 243.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 6 months.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.


Count 2:
74 Days Jail.  (Credit - 74 days).  CONCURRENT with Count 1.  COURT DEEMS TIME SERVED.

COSTS: $ 243.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 6 months.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter to Court re: Request a Plea and Sentencing hearing. Filed by Atty. Menden.   **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on May 5, 2022. Clerk to schedule a hearing.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
